title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 §§ 272-1.2 - Labeling and advertising requirements
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 §§ 272-1.2 - Labeling and advertising requirements

State Regulations
(a) Except as otherwise exempted in this

Part, no person shall produce, prepare, package, advertise, sell or offer for
sale at retail any meat unless it is clearly and conspicuously labeled or
advertised, as the case may be, as to its true name. (b) This section shall not require the
labeling of meat cut to the order of the retail customer. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
§§
272-1.2

Repealed

New

York State Register June 22, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 25, eff. 6/22/2016

Adopted

New

York State Register December 21, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 51, eff. 12/21/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
